title.narrative: Myanmar EMOP 10749.0 Food Assistance to Cyclone-Affected Populations in Myanmar

description.narrative: WFP will provide ready to eat food to children under 2 years of age and to pregnant & lactating women for a period of one month. The high energy biscuits will target all children under 5 years of age (estimated at 90,000 out of total targeted population of 750,000). This initial relief food is urgently needed in order to sustain vulnerable groups’ food needs and to cover the transitional period as the mechanism of food procurement and logistics and distribution systems are implemented. Rice rations compose of 12 kgs per month (400 grs. per day per person). The biscuits and ready to eat food will be imported as an immediate response for the initial period, in order to provide beneficiaries who have lost homes and cooking facilities until such time as they are able to obtain basic shelter and cooking facilities.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Myanmar EMOP 10749.0 Food Assistance to Cyclone-Affected Populations in Myanmar

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.
